content: Maxillary fractures refer to breaks or cracks in the bones of the maxilla, which is the bone that forms the upper jaw and supports the cheeks, eyes, and nasal cavity. These types of injuries can result from various causes such as motor vehicle accidents, falls, sports injuries, or facial trauma. Symptoms may include swelling, bruising, pain, difficulty breathing through the nose, and teeth not fitting together properly. It's important to seek medical attention for any suspected maxillary fracture as they can lead to complications if left untreated. Your healthcare professional will determine the best course of treatment based on the severity and location of the fracture.
